title: George Mason (rugby league)
text:
George Mason (d 1996) was a <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer, and later coach, for the <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown</a> club.
Career.
Mason played three seasons for <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs</a> between 1927 and 1929.
His final year as a player was 1936 at the newly admitted <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown</a> side playing in 12 matches.
Mason coached Canterbury-Bankstown for 1 season in 1937.
He is recognized as Canterbury's 41st ever player and their third ever coach. George Henry Mason died on 5 February 1996.
